document.docAuthor: Billet, Guillaume, Muizon, Christian De & Quispe, Bernardino Mamani
document.docOrigin: Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society 152 (1)
document.masterDocTitle: Late Oligocene mesotheriids (Mammalia, Notoungulata) from Salla and Lacayani (Bolivia): implications for basal mesotheriid phylogeny and distribution

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Late Oligocene mesotheriids (Mammalia, Notoungulata) from Salla and Lacayani (Bolivia): implications for basal mesotheriid phylogeny and distribution
Zoological Journal of the Linnean Society

subSubSection.paragraph: FIGURES 12B AND 16–18 , APPENDIX 4 ( TABLES A4 AND A 5 )

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Trachytherus Ameghino, 1889a: 1–8
, non Trachytherium Gervais, 1849,
Ameghino 1889b: 919
, plate 79 figs 1, 2, plate 97, fig. 3.

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Holotype :
MACN A235 : right maxillary and premaxillary with broken I1, P2–M2 and broken M3 (figured in Ameghino, 1889b ) ( Fig. 16A ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Marshall et al . (1986)
also mentioned four AMNH specimens (from the Deseadan Patagonian locality of Las Cascadas, Chubut , Argentina ): AMNH 116424 as
T. spegazzinianus , AMNH
116420, AMNH 116423 and AMNH 116442 as
T .
sp. (we were not able to see and study these specimens).

Localities: According to Ameghino (1889b) , the holotype MACN A235 comes from the Neuquén Province , Argentina . However, on a note with the specimen, the locality name ‘Santa Cruz’ has been substituted by ‘Neuquén’, probably by Bryan Patterson (A. Kramarz, pers. comm.). The reason for this correction is unknown. Furthermore, Reguero (1999) stated that ‘according to more precise data, these remains appear to come from the centre of Chubut and have been collected by Carlos Ameghino’. The exact locality of the holotype is therefore unknown. Specimen MLP 52-XI-2-1 must come from the same locality (see Discussion).

MACN A52-492
,
MACN A52-491
,
MACN A52-566
,
MACN A52-567
,
MACN A52-493
,
MACN A52-489
,
MACN A52-498
,
MACN A52-496
,
MACN A52-490
, UNPSJB PV 112,
AMNH 29564 ,
ACM 3264
, ACM s/n and
FMNH P13281
come from Cabeza Blanca , Chubut Province , Argentina (personal observation on specimen labels and Reguero, 1999 )
.
MACN A52- 495 (type of
Proedrium solitarium
)
comes from La Flecha , Santa Cruz Province , Argentina ( Reguero & Castro, 2004 ). Several
MACN specimens are of unspecified origin.
FMNH P13381
comes from Pico Truncado , Santa Cruz Province , Argentina ( Reguero, 1999 )
.
MACN 6867 ( holotype
T. curuzucuatiense
) comes from Arroyo Castillo , Department of Curuzú Cuatiá , Corrientes Province , Argentina ( Reguero, 1999 )
.

Finally, there are also numerous remains ( MLP ) from El Pajarito , Chubut Province , Argentina , and others ( SAL and MNHN-BOL-V) from Bolivia , Lacayani (see Discussion)
.
